COMMANDS.NAME: GUIDE
COMMANDS.SYNTAX: GUIDE [type] | GUIDE AI LIST [category] | GUIDE AI SHOW <id> | GUIDE AI RUN <id> [var=value...] | GUIDE AI SEARCH <query> | GUIDE AI STATS | GUIDE AI BUILD
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Knowledge system - Interactive guides (markdown) and AI instructions (perfected prompts). Use GUIDE for markdown docs, GUIDE AI for AI instruction library.
NOTES: GUIDE AI = AI instruction library (new - perfected with Gemini, run with Ollama)
Workflow: Use Gemini to perfect ‚Üí Save to knowledge/ai/ ‚Üí Execute offline
AI Categories: coding, writing, image, workflow, analysis, creative, system

COMMANDS.NAME: OK
COMMANDS.SYNTAX: OK MAKE SEQUENCE|FLOWCHART|SVG|ASCII|TELETEXT "<desc>" | OK MAKE WORKFLOW|DOC|TEST "<desc>" | OK ASK "<question>" | OK PROVIDER [mistral|gemini|claude|openai|vibe] | OK STATUS [--providers|--compare]
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Multi-Provider AI Assistant - Generate diagrams (SEQUENCE/FLOWCHART), graphics (SVG/ASCII/TELETEXT), workflows, docs, tests. Supports Mistral (FREE), Gemini, Claude, OpenAI, Vibe CLI (offline).
EXAMPLES: OK ASK how do I use TILE codes?
NOTES: Auto-routing: Dev mode = Mistral > Claude > Vibe > Gemini > OpenAI
Graphics: SEQUENCE (interactions), FLOWCHART (processes), SVG (custom), ASCII (text), TELETEXT (retro)

COMMANDS.NAME: LOCATION
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Privacy-first location and celestial navigation. View sky from your location, navigate by stars. Supports privacy masking in logs.

SUBCOMMANDS.SKY: View current sky (sun, moon, planets, stars)
SUBCOMMANDS.NAVIGATE: Navigate by star: LOCATION NAVIGATE Polaris
SUBCOMMANDS.ALIGN: Show Solar System layer aligned to your sky

NOTES: Privacy-first: Location masked in logs by default (L300:BD14-####)
Celestial navigation: Polaris altitude ‚âà your latitude
Solar System layer aligns with your actual sky view

COMMANDS.NAME: GET
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Get configuration field value interactively or explicitly from STORY, SYSTEM, or CONFIG.

DETAILS.EXPLICIT: Provide field path using dot notation

COMMANDS.NAME: SET
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Set configuration field value interactively or explicitly in STORY or CONFIG.

DETAILS.INTERACTIVE: No args - prompts for field and value

COMMANDS.NAME: CONFIG
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Manage .env configuration (API keys, installation ID, system settings).

COMMANDS.NAME: LOCATE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Set or view current real-world location on active planet. Enables location-aware survival knowledge.

COMMANDS.NAME: BLANK
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Clears the terminal screen.

COMMANDS.NAME: SPLASH
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Display full-screen splash graphics. LOGO shows uDOS block logo, STARTUP/REBOOT for system screens.

SUBCOMMANDS.TEXT: Display custom text as ASCII banner

COMMANDS.NAME: LOADER
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Modular terminal loader with animated U block logo, scrolling effects, NES-style cursor. Programmable via uPY. Tauri-compatible.

SUBCOMMANDS.BACKGROUND: Set effect (rainbow-stripe, matrix, grid, wave, pulse)
SUBCOMMANDS.PRESET: Load preset (default, matrix, retro, minimal, nes)

NOTES: U block graphic animation with no line gaps
Five presets: default, matrix, retro, minimal, nes
Five effects: rainbow-stripe, matrix, grid, wave, pulse

COMMANDS.NAME: HELP
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Provides help for a specific command.

COMMANDS.NAME: FEEDBACK
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Submit feedback, confusion points, or feature requests to improve uDOS. Captures session context automatically.
EXAMPLES: FEEDBACK "MAP CREATE is confusing" TYPE confusion

COMMANDS.NAME: REPORT
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Submit a detailed bug report or issue with reproduction steps and session context.
EXAMPLES: REPORT TITLE="Menu overlap" DESC="Text overlaps in narrow terminals"
REPORT TITLE="MAP fails" DESC="KeyError on CREATE" SEVERITY high
REPORT TITLE="Add feature" DESC="Dark mode support" CATEGORY feature_request
NOTES: Severity: critical, high, medium, low, info

COMMANDS.NAME: ROLE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Display current user role. Use CONFIG ROLE to change between user and wizard roles. Wizard role enables OK DEV and advanced system features.
NOTES: Wizard role enables OK DEV command for GitHub Copilot CLI
Wizard role grants access to advanced system features
Use CONFIG ROLE <role> to change: user | wizard

COMMANDS.NAME: HISTORY
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Enhanced command history management with intelligent search, statistics, and export capabilities.

COMMANDS.NAME: DEV
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: uPY script debugger for ALL USERS. Set breakpoints, step through code, inspect variables in your memory/ucode/ scripts. For core file editing (master only), use 'DEV MODE ON' instead.

FLAGS.STEP: Execute one line at a time

NOTES: v1.2.21 - Debugger available to ALL users for memory/ucode/ scripts
For core file editing (core/knowledge/extensions), use: DEV MODE ON

COMMANDS.NAME: MODE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Switch between prompt modes. Each mode changes the prompt indicator and provides different capabilities.
NOTES: Priority: DEV > GHOST > TOMB > CRYPT > ASSIST > COMMAND

COMMANDS.NAME: GHOST
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Toggle GHOST mode for isolated sandbox testing. No persistent changes, network disabled.

COMMANDS.NAME: TOMB
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Toggle TOMB mode for read-only archival access. Local storage only, no networking.

COMMANDS.NAME: CRYPT
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Toggle CRYPT mode for archival with networking. Location/beacon/key sharing enabled.

COMMANDS.NAME: SHOW
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Universal file viewer with smart type detection. .json ‚Üí JSON viewer, .py ‚Üí conversion offer to .upy, .md ‚Üí Typo preview, .upy/.txt ‚Üí terminal. Opens file picker if no path provided.

FLAGS.--web: Open file in web browser (markdown viewer)

NOTES: üêç .py ‚Üí User: convert to .upy | Dev Mode: edit Python directly
üîì Python editing requires Dev Mode permissions

COMMANDS.NAME: RUN
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Executes a script file containing uDOS commands.

COMMANDS.NAME: EDIT
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Opens a file in a text editor. Supports CLI editors (micro, nano, vim) and web editors (typo). Use --config to view available editors, --install-micro to install micro editor.

FLAGS.--editor <name>: Use specific editor (e.g., nano, vim, micro)
FLAGS.--config: Show editor configuration and available editors

COMMANDS.NAME: FILE PICK
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Interactive file picker with fuzzy search capabilities. Use pattern to filter files.

COMMANDS.NAME: FILE RECENT
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Show recently accessed files with access frequency and timestamps.

COMMANDS.NAME: FILE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Universal file handler with smart type detection. Handles .md, .upy, .py, .json, .txt files intelligently. Interactive menu when called without parameters.

SUBCOMMANDS.SHOW: View file (JSON viewer for .json, uPY converter for .py, Typo for .md)
SUBCOMMANDS.COPY: Copy file within or between workspaces
SUBCOMMANDS.PREVIEW: Preview with metadata and git status

NOTES: ‚úÖ v1.2.24 - Universal file handler with smart type detection
üêç .py ‚Üí User: convert to .upy | Admin: edit Python directly (Dev Mode)
üìú .upy ‚Üí User scripting format with bracket syntax
üîì Python editing requires Dev Mode (admin/wizard permissions)
Interactive menu when called without parameters

COMMANDS.NAME: FILE BATCH
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Batch file operations with pattern matching. Delete, copy, or move multiple files at once.

COMMANDS.NAME: FILE BOOKMARKS
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Manage persistent bookmark system with tags and custom names.

COMMANDS.NAME: FILE PREVIEW
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Preview file content with metadata and git status display.

COMMANDS.NAME: FILE INFO
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Show comprehensive file information and statistics.

COMMANDS.NAME: BANK
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Access the local data bank. Without subcommand, defaults to LIST. Use BANK SEARCH to search, BANK SHOW to display content, etc.

COMMANDS.NAME: BANK SEARCH
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Search the local data bank with full-text search and ranking.

COMMANDS.NAME: BANK LIST
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Browse data bank by categories and topics.

COMMANDS.NAME: BANK SHOW
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Display data bank content with panel integration.

COMMANDS.NAME: BANK INDEX
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Manual reindexing of data bank with statistics.

COMMANDS.NAME: BANK STATS
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Show comprehensive data bank metrics and statistics.

COMMANDS.NAME: BANK CATEGORIES
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: List all data bank categories and their overview.

COMMANDS.NAME: REPAIR
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: System health check and repair with extension management. Validates Python environment, dependencies, file structure, git repository, and extensions. Can auto-fix issues, pull updates from GitHub, upgrade pip, or clone recommended extensions (micro, typo, cmd, monaspace).

FLAGS.--clone <name>: Clone specific extension (micro, typo, cmd, monaspace)

COMMANDS.NAME: UNDO
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Undoes the last reversible operation.

COMMANDS.NAME: REDO
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Redoes the last undone operation.

COMMANDS.NAME: RESTORE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Restores state to a previous session (bulk undo). Use RESTORE LIST to see available sessions.

COMMANDS.NAME: SHAKEDOWN
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive v1.5.0 system validation test suite. Tests architecture cleanup (17‚Üí11 core dirs), planet system integration, asset management, DEV MODE security, memory structure (28‚Üí16 dirs), database locations, startup health, and core module imports. Options: --verbose (detailed output), --quick (core tests only), --report (generate JSON report).

COMMANDS.NAME: REBOOT
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Restarts uDOS or reloads extensions. Full restart re-detects system settings and viewport. Hot reload variants (v1.2.4+): --extensions (reload all extensions), --extension <id> (reload single extension), --validate (dry-run validation).

FLAGS.--extensions: Reload all extensions without full system restart
FLAGS.--extension <id>: Reload a single extension by ID

COMMANDS.NAME: POKE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Web server and extension management. Start/stop extension servers (dashboard, teletext, terminal), check status, discover available extensions, and manage installations.
NOTES: Extension servers run on localhost ports

COMMANDS.NAME: DESTROY
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Destructive reset command - clears workspace and optionally resets entire installation. Always prompts for confirmation. Options: --all (clear sandbox + memory + logs), --env (also delete .env), --reset (complete reset + fresh git clone). Auto-reboots after execution.

FLAGS.--all: Clear sandbox, memory, and all logs
FLAGS.--reset: Complete reset: clear everything + reset git repository to GitHub state

COMMANDS.NAME: BACKUP
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: File backup operations with archive system integration. Create timestamped backups or validate backup system health.

FLAGS.--validate: Validate backup system and report archive directory status

COMMANDS.NAME: TIME
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Display and manage timezone settings. Shows current time with timezone info, TILE code, and city.
NOTES: ‚úÖ Active in v1.2.31 - Core Time & Date System
Shows timezone abbreviation and UTC offset
Associated TILE code displayed when available
Supports IANA timezone names and city lookups

COMMANDS.NAME: CLOCK
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Display current time in large ASCII 7-segment digits. Use MULTI to show all tracked timezones.
NOTES: ‚úÖ Active in v1.2.31 - Core Time & Date System
Large ASCII art display of current time
MULTI shows all zones added via TIME ADD

COMMANDS.NAME: TIMER
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Countdown timer with large ASCII display and science-based egg presets. Duration: 5m, 1h30m, 2:30:00. Egg types: soft, mollet, jammy, medium, hard, hardmax.
NOTES: ‚úÖ Active in v1.2.31 - Core Time & Date System
EGG adjusts for: fridge-cold eggs (+1m), batch size, altitude
EGG STORY: 'The Perfect Egg' narrative cooking guide

COMMANDS.NAME: EGG
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Alias for TIMER EGG. Science-based egg timer. Types: soft, mollet, jammy, medium, hard, hardmax.
NOTES: Shortcut alias - equivalent to TIMER EGG
See TIMER command for full documentation

COMMANDS.NAME: STOPWATCH
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Lap timer for timing activities. Records lap times for later review.
NOTES: ‚úÖ Active in v1.2.31 - Core Time & Date System

COMMANDS.NAME: DRAW
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: 24√ó24 tile editor for creating teletext-style character art. Supports TUI (terminal) and Desktop (web) modes.
NOTES: Colors: 8 WST teletext colors (red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white, black)
Export formats: ascii (plain), ansi (colored), json (full data)

COMMANDS.NAME: CAL
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Calendar views with timezone and location integration. Display monthly, weekly, or daily schedules with task indicators.
NOTES: Shows timezone (AEST/UTC/etc) and TILE code in headers
Use CAL NEXT/PREV to navigate between time periods

COMMANDS.NAME: TASK
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Task management integrated with calendar system. Create, track, and complete tasks with priority levels and due dates.
NOTES: Integrates with CAL DAY view for daily task display

COMMANDS.NAME: EXTENSION
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Manage uDOS extensions. Commands: STATUS (show all extensions), ENABLE <id>, DISABLE <id>, INFO <id>.

COMMANDS.NAME: TILE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Grid tile operations. Commands: INFO <code> (show tile details), LIST (show all tiles).

COMMANDS.NAME: STATUS
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Shows system status including connection mode, servers, and health. Use --live for real-time monitoring.

FLAGS.--live: Enable real-time monitoring mode (update every 3 seconds)

COMMANDS.NAME: CLEAN
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Flush and cleanup workspace directories. Empties .archive/ folders, removes old logs, cleans artifacts. Default interactive with confirmation.

FLAGS.--dry-run: Preview what would be cleaned without removing

COMMANDS.NAME: TIDY
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Organize and sort files in workspace directories. Detects duplicates via MD5 hashing, finds old versions by naming patterns, archives automatically.

FLAGS.--versions: Find and archive old version files

NOTES: ‚úÖ Updated in v1.2.21 - Duplicate detection, version archiving
Uses MD5 hashing to identify exact duplicates
Detects old versions via regex patterns (_YYYYMMDD_, _vN)

COMMANDS.NAME: CLONE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Package user content for system duplication. Creates tar.gz archive of docs, drafts, scripts, workflows, user settings. Excludes .archive/ folders and logs.

FLAGS.--check: Preview package contents without creating archive

NOTES: ‚úÖ NEW in v1.2.21 - User content packaging
Packages: memory/docs/, memory/drafts/, memory/ucode/scripts/, memory/workflows/, memory/bank/user/
Use for backup, transfer, or system duplication

COMMANDS.NAME: INBOX
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Process files from memory/inbox/ - filters scraped business data CSV files, extracts email-only records, geocodes addresses to TILE codes, formats social links.

SUBCOMMANDS.PROCESS [file]: Process CSV file(s) - filters by email, geocodes locations, generates TILE codes
SUBCOMMANDS.LIST: List all CSV files waiting in inbox
SUBCOMMANDS.STATUS: Show inbox status and file count

NOTES: ‚úÖ NEW in v1.2.22 - Automated inbox processing for scraped business data
Filters: Retains only records with valid email addresses
Extracts: Business name, email, phone, website, social links (FB/IG/LinkedIn)
Geocodes: Parses FullAddress ‚Üí Street, Suburb, Postcode, Country
TILE codes: Converts lat/long to uDOS grid format (AA340-100)
Use INBOX CLEAN to archive processed files

COMMANDS.NAME: BUILD
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Pre-download repositories and create offline installation package. Clones optional repos (MeshCore, CoreUI) and packages core system for distribution.
NOTES: ‚úÖ NEW in v1.2.21 - Offline installation packaging
Packages: core/, extensions/, knowledge/, wiki/, requirements.txt
Use for offline distribution or air-gapped installations

COMMANDS.NAME: VIEWPORT
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Displays current terminal viewport and grid layout.

COMMANDS.NAME: PALETTE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Displays the Polaroid color palette with visual tests and reference.

COMMANDS.NAME: DASH
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Display comprehensive system dashboard. Use 'DASH WEB' to open interactive web dashboard in browser. Alias: DASHBOARD

COMMANDS.NAME: MAP
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Shows current map position and layer information.

COMMANDS.NAME: GOTO
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Teleport to specific coordinates on current map layer.

COMMANDS.NAME: STEP
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Move relative to current position (NetHack-style navigation).

COMMANDS.NAME: LAYER
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Switch to a different map layer or list available layers.

COMMANDS.NAME: DESCEND
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Descend one layer (NetHack > command) - go deeper.

COMMANDS.NAME: ASCEND
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Ascend one layer (NetHack < command) - go higher.

COMMANDS.NAME: LOCATE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Set your real-world location to a major city.

COMMANDS.NAME: WIZARD
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Run interactive setup wizard for first-time configuration. SETUP is an alias for backward compatibility.
NOTES: WIZARD or WIZARD WIZARD runs full interactive setup
SETUP is deprecated - use WIZARD for setup, or CONFIG for settings

COMMANDS.NAME: TREE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Generate and display GitHub repository structure (2 levels deep). TREE updates structure.txt and shows root tree (GitHub repo only, excludes local folders). MEMORY TREE shows memory tree. KNOWLEDGE TREE shows knowledge tree. TREE --sizes <path> shows directory with file sizes.
NOTES: TREE shows GitHub repo only (no memory/, library/, distribution/, etc.)
Shows 2 levels deep for good overview
Updates structure.txt each time it's run
Use MEMORY TREE or KNOWLEDGE TREE for those specific trees

COMMANDS.NAME: TUI
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Manage Terminal User Interface components. Enable/disable keypad navigation (numpad controls), command predictions, enhanced paging, and file browser.

COMPONENTS.PREDICTOR: Real-time command predictions with syntax highlighting

NOTES: Keypad disabled by default to avoid number input conflicts
Enable keypad when you want keyboard-only navigation

COMMANDS.NAME: DEVICE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Manage input device detection and configuration. Detect keyboard, mouse, and terminal capabilities. Switch between keypad, full keyboard, and hybrid input modes.

MODES.full_keyboard: All keys including arrows, function keys

NOTES: v1.2.25: Device detection and input mode management
Touch support requires extensions/input extension (EXPLORER+ tiers)

COMMANDS.NAME: KEYPAD
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Universal KEYPAD system demonstration. Shows number-based selection (1-9), menu navigation, and list browsing with standardized formatting.

COMMANDS.NAME: MOUSE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Mouse input system for TUI. Click detection (left/right/middle), double-click, drag-and-drop, scroll wheel, clickable regions, and position tracking.

FEATURES.drag: Click and drag with threshold detection

NOTES: Regions defined in terminal character units

COMMANDS.NAME: SELECTOR
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Unified selector framework for TUI components. Standardizes selection behavior across menus, lists, file browsers, and all interactive panels.

SUBCOMMANDS.SELECTOR DEMO: Interactive demonstration of all selector types

FEATURES.consistent_api: Unified API across all TUI components

NOTES: Compatible with KEYPAD and MOUSE systems
Used by all TUI panels and browsers

COMMANDS.NAME: PEEK
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Fetch and parse data from URLs or local documents. Supports Markdown (.md), JSON (.json), SVG (.svg), and HTML. Auto-saves to memory/sandbox.

SUPPORTED_FORMATS.svg: Shows SVG metadata and first 20 lines
SUPPORTED_FORMATS.html: Strips tags and shows text content

NOTES: Content is saved to sandbox/peek/ by default
Large content is truncated for display (not storage)

COMMANDS.NAME: THEME
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Manage uDOS personality themes. Switch between DUNGEON (fantasy), GALAXY (sci-fi comedy), FOUNDATION (serious survival), SCIENCE (research methodology), and PROJECT (business concise). Each theme changes command names, messages, and overall verbosity. Use theme name directly as shortcut (e.g., THEME GALAXY).

SUBCOMMANDS.LIST: Display all available themes with descriptions
SUBCOMMANDS.<name>: Shortcut to change theme directly (DUNGEON, GALAXY, FOUNDATION, SCIENCE, or PROJECT)

NOTES: Theme changes take effect on next restart
Changes all command names and system messages
Use HELP after theme change to see new command vocabulary

COMMANDS.NAME: NEW
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Create a new file from template in the current workspace. Interactive prompts for filename, workspace selection, and template type. Supports ISO 8601 timestamp prefixes.

FLAGS.--located: Add location suffix with TILE code

NOTES: Templates include: blank, note, quest, config, script
Interactive mode guides you through all choices
‚úÖ v1.2.23: Compact timestamp format with timezone codes
Timezone codes: UTC, EST, PST, GMT, CET, JST, AEST (from timezones.json)

COMMANDS.NAME: DELETE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Delete a file from current workspace with confirmation dialog. Shows file list if no filename provided.
NOTES: Shows all files in current workspace for selection
Cannot be undone - file is permanently removed

COMMANDS.NAME: COPY
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Copy a file within current workspace or to another workspace. Optionally rename during copy.
NOTES: Can copy to same or different workspace
Auto-generates _copy suffix if no destination name

COMMANDS.NAME: MOVE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Move file between workspaces or rename within workspace. File is removed from source location.
NOTES: File is removed from original location

COMMANDS.NAME: RENAME
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Rename a file in current workspace. Keep same extension for consistency.

COMMANDS.NAME: MEMORY
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Access memory system with 4 tiers (PRIVATE, SHARED, COMMUNITY, PUBLIC). Manage personal and shared knowledge.
NOTES: Each tier has different security and speed

COMMANDS.NAME: KNOWLEDGE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Access the knowledge bank directory. KNOWLEDGE TREE shows the knowledge directory structure.
NOTES: Routes to TREE handler to display knowledge/ directory structure

COMMANDS.NAME: WORKSPACE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Manage workspace isolation. Three workspaces: sandbox (experiments), memory (storage), data (config).

SUBCOMMANDS.LIST: Show all workspaces with file counts

NOTES: Use MOVE to transfer files between workspaces

COMMANDS.NAME: SETUP
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Quick setup - display or modify system settings. For full configuration options use CONFIG command.
NOTES: SETUP is a quick view of settings - use CONFIG for full interactive menu
SETTINGS is an alias for SETUP (backward compatibility)
SETUP EDIT redirects to CONFIG interactive menu
Changes apply to both CLI and web interface

COMMANDS.NAME: GUIDE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Interactive knowledge viewer with step-through tutorials and progress tracking.

SUBCOMMANDS.NEXT: Move to next step in current guide

COMMANDS.NAME: DIAGRAM
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: ASCII art library browser and content generator - search, view, export diagrams, and generate new content with Gemini API (v1.6.0).

FLAGS.--crawl: Enable web crawler for supplementary content (GENERATE)

SUBCOMMANDS.GENERATE: Generate content + Technical-Kinetic SVGs with Gemini API (v1.6.0)

NOTES: ‚ú® v1.6.0: GENERATE creates content with mandatory citations
Multi-format: MD (text), SVG (vector), ASCII (terminal), Teletext (retro web)
ASCII: C64 PETSCII 80x24, Teletext: WST 40x25 8-color mosaic
Technical-Kinetic SVG style: monochrome MCM + kinetic flow
Multi-stage: Analysis ‚Üí Crawl ‚Üí Text ‚Üí SVG ‚Üí Assembly

COMMANDS.NAME: LOGS
COMMANDS.SYNTAX: LOGS STATUS | LOGS CLEANUP [--dry-run] | LOGS SEARCH <pattern> | LOGS ARCHIVE [month] | LOGS HELP
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Manage uDOS logging system with flat directory structure.

SUBCOMMANDS.STATUS: Show logging statistics and current log files
SUBCOMMANDS.CLEANUP: Clean up old logs per retention policy (--dry-run to preview)
SUBCOMMANDS.ARCHIVE: Archive logs to compressed file (default: last month)

NOTES: Category-based naming: system-, web-, ucode-, workflow-, etc.
Retention policies: Daily logs (30d), Mission logs (never), Debug logs (7d)

COMMANDS.NAME: DRAW
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Generate ASCII/Unicode diagrams (flowcharts, trees, grids, hierarchies).
NOTES: Auto type detection from natural language

COMMANDS.NAME: MAKE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Unified graphics generation system supporting 5 formats (ASCII, Teletext, SVG, Sequence, Flow). Replaces old GENERATE/DIAGRAM commands.

FORMATS.ascii: Template-based ASCII art with variable substitution
FORMATS.svg: AI-assisted SVG diagrams with style templates

TELETEXT_PALETTES: earth: Warm earthy tones for survival content
SVG_STYLES: technical: Clean technical diagrams with precise lines

NOTES: Size limits: ASCII 5KB, Teletext 10KB, SVG 50KB, Sequence 5KB, Flow 5KB
42 total templates (25 ASCII + 4 Teletext + 3 SVG + 5 Sequence + 5 Flow)

COMMANDS.NAME: PROMPT
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Admin-only AI prompt management for graphics generation. Requires DEV MODE.
COMMANDS.REQUIRES: DEV MODE enabled (CONFIG SET dev_mode true)

SUBCOMMANDS.LIST [format]: List all prompts or filter by format (ascii/svg/etc.)
SUBCOMMANDS.STATS: Show usage statistics for all prompts

PROMPT_STRUCTURE.CONTENT: Markdown prompt text with variable substitution

NOTES: ‚ö†Ô∏è ADMIN ONLY - Prompts control AI behavior
File format: YAML frontmatter + Markdown content
Security: DEV MODE check enforced at handler level

COMMANDS.NAME: SVG
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Generate AI-powered SVG vector diagrams (requires Gemini API).

COMMANDS.NAME: MISSION
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Mission Control system for managing long-running projects with moves and steps.
NOTES: Work measured in STEPS and MOVES (not time)

COMMANDS.NAME: SCHEDULE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Cron-like task scheduling for automation.
NOTES: Background task queue with worker thread

COMMANDS.NAME: CHECKPOINT
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Save/restore mission state snapshots (like git commits for progress).
NOTES: ‚úÖ Core Command v1.2.24 - Mission milestone tracking

COMMANDS.NAME: XP
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Experience points tracking (value/progress currency in barter system).
NOTES: Used for unlocking features, tracking achievements

COMMANDS.NAME: ITEM
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Basic inventory management (add/remove items from user inventory).
NOTES: ‚úÖ Core Command v1.2.24 - Simple resource tracking

COMMANDS.NAME: BARTER
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Value exchange system (offer/request/trade items, skills, XP).

COMMANDS.NAME: WORKFLOW
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Workflow automation commands (LOG, LOAD_JSON, SAVE_JSON, etc.).

COMMANDS.NAME: RESOURCE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Resource management (API quotas, disk space, CPU, memory).

COMMANDS.NAME: SPRITE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Character/sprite management with JSON schema validation.
NOTES: Files saved to sandbox/user/ by default

COMMANDS.NAME: OBJECT
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Item/object catalog management with JSON schema validation.
NOTES: Categories: weapon, armor, consumable, key-item, etc.

COMMANDS.NAME: TIDY
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Alpha v1.0.0.0+ Organize files into .archive, .tmp, .dev folders. Interactive menu by default.
NOTES: Shows interactive menu when no params
Moves files matching patterns to appropriate folders

COMMANDS.NAME: CLEAN
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Alpha v1.0.0.0+ Delete files from local-only folders. Interactive menu by default.
NOTES: Shows interactive menu when no params

COMMANDS.NAME: BUNDLE
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Content package management with scheduled drip delivery. Bundles are self-contained learning/content packages with manifest.yaml.

SUBCOMMANDS.PLAN: Use AI to plan a new bundle structure

NOTES: Each bundle has manifest.yaml with schedule
Drip types: immediate, daily, weekly, on-complete
Integrates with WELLBEING for energy costs

COMMANDS.NAME: CAPTURE
COMMANDS.SYNTAX: CAPTURE <url> [--pipeline TYPE] | CAPTURE LIST | CAPTURE PROCESS [--all] | CAPTURE CLEAR | CAPTURE LINKS <url> | CAPTURE STATUS
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Web content capture pipeline. Fetches URLs and converts to markdown/teletext for offline reading.
NOTES: Pipelines: markdown (default), news, docs, recipe, teletext
Integrates with TILE for viewing captured content

COMMANDS.NAME: WELLBEING
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: User energy and mood tracking for adaptive task suggestions. Privacy-first local tracking.

SUBCOMMANDS.SUGGEST: Get activity suggestions based on state

NOTES: Integrates with BUNDLE for drip pacing
Suggests task types based on energy level

COMMANDS.NAME: TIDY
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Organize files into appropriate local-only folders (.archive, .dev, .tmp). Move old backups, drafts, and temporary files automatically.
NOTES: Use --backup to create safety snapshot before operation
Run CLEAN after TIDY to delete old archived files

COMMANDS.NAME: CLEAN
COMMANDS.DESCRIPTION: Delete files from local-only folders (.archive, .tmp, .dev, logs). Use with caution - destructive operation!

SUBCOMMANDS.--backup: Create backup first (automatic for destructive ops)

NOTES: Run TIDY first to organize files before cleaning
